item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "God help thee, old man, thy thoughts have created a creature in thee; and he whose intense thinking thus makes him a Prometheus; a vulture feeds upon that heart forever; the vulture the very creature he creates." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "It is not down on any map; true places never are." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off - then, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I try all things, I achieve what I can." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "As for me, I am tormented with an everlasting itch for things remote. I love to sail forbidden seas, and land on barbarous coasts." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "The problem with the world is that the intelligent people are full of doubts, while the stupid ones are full of confidence." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I'm too tough for him, I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "those who escape hell however never talk about it and nothing much bothers them after that." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Miasma add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "The human race had always disgusted me. essentially, what made them disgusting was the family-relationship illness, which included marriage, exchange of power and aid, which neighborhood, your district, your city, your county, your state, your nation-everybody grabbing each other's assholes in the Honeycomb of survival out of a fear-animalistic stupidity." -- Charles Bukowski
